page.title: 16R.FOWLER CENTRE MELKSHAM
page.content: The Rachel Fowler Centre is a converted church. You can still see remains of its older use inside. It is nmed after a woman who helped the church. The centre is used for artistic events from local history exhibitions to peotry readings and plays. It is a sort of museum. Plays are often staged there , for instance at Christmas there is a pantomime. In the holidays a small Punch and Judy show is held in the afternoons for little children. You have to pay money to get in, but children get in free. On most evenings they have something on. There is a good response to the events held. People can hire the centre for wedding receptions and musical evenings. It is considered to be a good amenity in our town.
